title: Add authors to all crates
Create default enabled features for large web events

labels.name: web
labels.description: relating to the web renderer for dioxus

body: Some of the web events are quite large and rairly used. For example, the onmounted event will not be used in most applications. This PR pulls those events out into features that are enabled by default so that users can use the crate with no default features for smaller binary sizes

title: Don't spawn a new tokio runtime every fullstack request
body:
This reuses a pool of futures instead of spawning a new tokio runtime on every request which should make server function performance better.

For a server function returning static text, this seems to be about twice as fast

title: Switch to launch builder instead of macro for fullstack
Make deprecated use router
body: Creates a deprecated use_router hook to make transitioning to the new router easier

title: Make more of core private

labels.name: core
labels.description: relating to the core implementation of the virtualdom

body: There are a few places in core where we expose more of the API of the nodes than we need to for the renderers. This PR makes a few more things private to reduce breaking changes in the future

title: Create cli bundle command
body:
Creates a bundle command for the CLI desktop targets.

Currently this has only been confirmed to work for Windows (x64) and MacOs (arm). Linux targets have not been tested.

title: Fix finding files with a custom map_path
body: The ssr crate has a map_path field that maps a route to a local path. It uses that function correctly when generating files, but not when searching files. This PR applies the function when searching files as well.

title: Remove autogenerated functions/components from the routable macro
body:
This PR removes the auto generated:
- Router
- Link
- Outlet
- use_route
- use_navigator
- GoBackButton
- GoForwardButton

Instead they are included in the core router crate prelude. The following functions/Components need manual generics:
- Router
- Outlet
- use_route

This PR makes the rest of them work without generics.

title: Make SsrState public
body: Makes the fullstack renderer struct (SsrState)'s constructor public. This allows external libraries to create adapters for different frameworks using SsrState

title: Fix root component suspense

labels.name: core
labels.description: relating to the core implementation of the virtualdom

body:
Currently, the Vdom panics when the root component is suspended. This PR treats the root component like any other aborted component instead.

This should let us simplify our examples and docs a bit

title: Fix all broken examples
body: I went through all the examples in the Dioxus repo and tested them before the 0.4 release. There are a few examples that were broken. This PR fixes them

title: Make new enum router less breaking
Add is_child_of function to Routable
Bump actions/checkout from 2 to 3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: github_actions
labels.description: Pull requests that update GitHub Actions code

body:
Bumps [actions/checkout](https://github.com/actions/checkout) from 2 to 3.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/checkout's releases.

v3.0.0

  • Updated to the node16 runtime by default
    • This requires a minimum Actions Runner version of v2.285.0 to run, which is by default available in GHES 3.4 or later.

v2.7.0

What's Changed

  • Add new public key for known_hosts (#1237) by @​TingluoHuang in actions/checkout#1238

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v2.6.0...v2.7.0

v2.6.0

What's Changed

  • Add backports to v2 branch by @​cory-miller in actions/checkout#1040
    • Includes backports from the following changes: actions/checkout#964, actions/checkout#1002, actions/checkout#1029
    • Upgraded the licensed version to match what is used in v3.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v2.5.0...v2.6.0

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v2...v2.5.0

v2.4.2

What's Changed

  • Prepare changelog for v2.4.2. by @​TingluoHuang in actions/checkout#778

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v2...v2.4.2

v2.4.1

  • Fixed an issue where checkout failed to run in container jobs due to the new git setting safe.directory

v2.4.0

  • Convert SSH URLs like org-<ORG_ID>@github.com: to https://github.com/ - pr

v2.3.5

Update dependencies

v2.3.3

  • Remove Unneeded commit information from build logs

v3.5.3

v3.5.2

v3.5.1

  • Fix slow checkout on Windows

v3.5.0

v3.4.0

  • Upgrade codeql actions to v2

v3.3.0

  • Implement branch list using callbacks from exec function
  • Add in explicit reference to private checkout options
  • [Fix comment typos (that got added in #770)](actions/checkout#1057)

v3.2.0

  • Add GitHub Action to perform release
  • Fix status badge
  • Replace datadog/squid with ubuntu/squid Docker image
  • Wrap pipeline commands for submoduleForeach in quotes
  • Update @​actions/io to 1.1.2

v3.1.0

  • Use @​actions/core saveState and getState
  • Add github-server-url input

v3.0.2

  • Add input set-safe-directory

v3.0.1

  • Fixed an issue where checkout failed to run in container jobs due to the new git setting safe.directory
  • Bumped various npm package versions

v3.0.0

  • Update to node 16

v2.3.1

... (truncated)

title: docs(clean): fix copy-paste docs from `build`
fix(playwright): remove unnecessary `await`s
body: `page.locator` is a synchronous method.

title: fix: Use correct cfg for file_watcher feature in dioxus-hot-reload
body:
- Made `Config` public again
- Fix import in file_watcher.rs
- Use correct cfg syntax for `file_watcher` feature

title: fix: Update use_coroutine example
body: Just another one of my high quality PRs

title: Fix use_future always spawning a new task and never updating
body: Fixes a regression on use future that makes it always respawn the task and always return a stale unresolved value

title: Fix route prerendering
body: The router incremental rendering feature currently does not rebuild the router before waiting for suspense. This breaks the static-hydrated example in fullstack. This PR adds rebuilding to fix that.

title: Log errors when a component fails to render

labels.name: core
labels.description: relating to the core implementation of the virtualdom

body: When a component fails to render on desktop/ssr, dioxus will catch the error and render a placeholder. This PR adds a log::error to let the developer know what component failed to render and what the error was

title: Add computed hook
body: Adds a new computed hook that allows you to efficiently diff data before marking any scopes that read from the data as dirty. This is similar to a selector

title: Optimize the remove_attribute function

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

body: This seemed to be slightly faster than the current remove_future function. It should also be more readable

title: Update license field following SPDX 2.1 license expression standard
body: The new recommendation is to follow the SPDX 2.1 standard. This allows automatic license verification software to work properly. Reference: https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-license-and-license-file-fields

title: Fix: dont use bumpslab anymore, just box scopestates
body:
While working on #1225 I noticed that miri isn't passing in one of our tests. I think it's a new regression.

This change expands our CI to run miri on every core test and removes the bumpslab in favor of simply boxing each scope state.

We take a slight performance hit but I don't think it matters too much. And now, we know that scopestates properly drop their contents.

title: Improve auto formatting multiline raw attributes/event handlers
body: Fixes a few issues I ran into while trying to get autofmt to work for the docsite. Mainly handlers with multiple lines and multi-line raw attributes were not formatted correctly

title: Fix race condition in use_future by using use_state directly.
body:
We have a lot of vestigial code from when use_future was meant to work with async components.

This cleans all that up and relies on use_state directly, since use_future is basically a glorified use_state.

title: Add caching to windows CI, and build for Android + iOS
body:
I'm using tauri's CI as a template here. 

Adds caching to windows and combines mac/win/linux/ios/android under one matrix.

title: Kill previous CI jobs when new pushed
body: Uses concurrency features of github actions to prevent us from draining CI for hours.

title: Don't use boxed cell slice, use a refcell instead

labels.name: core
labels.description: relating to the core implementation of the virtualdom

body:
Removes 9 instances of unsafe by using a Refcell<vec> instead of UnsafeCell<Box>.

Should also be less to compile.
There's a small overhead but the hinting to the branch predictor should be basically negligible.

title: Halve Build Times
body:
This roughly halfs build times for a hello world example.

Relies on https://github.com/DioxusLabs/prettier-please/pull/1 being published as the `0.2` version

title: Fix playwright (again) and move the playwright stuff into the playwright directory
body: The package.json and package.lock are cluttering up the top-level crate and might make more sense to leave in a subfolder.

title: feat(check): adds `dx check`
body: At the moment this only checks the [Rules of Hooks](https://dioxuslabs.com/docs/0.3/guide/en/interactivity/hooks.html ), ensuring that hook functions (i.e. `use_*`) are being called as expected. TODO: - [x] more tests - [ ] add Rules of Hooks link to issue report output? Closes #1202

title: Prepare for Sledgehammer Bindgen in Liveview
body: This makes changes to the liveview renderer to prepare for #695. This is the only breaking change that moving to sledgehammer will require for liveview. Sledgehammer bindgen will require a stream of bytes instead of a stream of strings. Integrating with sledgehammer will be done after 0.4, but after this PR it should be a non-breaking change.

title: Move desktop hot reload into the CLI
body:
This PR moves hot reloading from the hot_reload_init macro to the CLI.

This has a few advantages:
- Hot reloading can detect changes when rebuilding the application
- All platforms use the CLI to serve applications

title: Fixed typo in Router guide getting-started.md
body:
PR is largely self-explanatory.

The [Getting Started page for the Dioxus Router](https://dioxuslabs.com/docs/0.3/router/guide/getting-started.html) says we should use:
`rustup target add wasm32-unkown-unknown`, however the correct target is
`rustup target add wasm32-unknown-unknown`.

This PR adds the missing `n` to the first `unknown`.

title: chore: rename `playwrite` to `playwright`
body: I assume this was a mistake and not intentional.

title: fix: Update use_ref docs
fix(cli): improve error message for invalid config
body:
Previously an invalid `Dioxus.toml` file would yield this error when running e.g. `dx serve`:

```
Error: Failed to load `Dioxus.toml` because: Dioxus.toml parse failed
```

This doesn't give any indication why it failed to parse. This commit updates it to include why the parsing failed, e.g.:

```
Error: Failed to load Dioxus config because: Dioxus.toml missing field `name` for key `application` at line 38 column 1
```

I initially had it format the message to include `Dioxus.toml:38:1` to be clickable in some terminals, but the location specified didn't always seem particularly relevant to the actual problem so I left it as-is.

This also fixes what I believe would be an issue on case-sensitive file systems where if `dioxus.toml` existed it would try to read `Dioxus.toml`.

I'm still fairly new to Rust, so the `.as_path()` calls may not be the best way to deal with the fact that the borrow checker wouldn't let me re-use `crate_dir` and `dioxus_conf_file`. I'm open to suggestions!

title: Use server function hook
CLI Bin Flag
body:
Adds a ``--bin`` flag to the ``clean``, ``build``, and ``serve`` commands.
E.g. ``dx serve --bin desktop``

This PR also un-folder-nests the commands.

Closes #1190

title: Rip out async components in favor of a simpler suspense
body:
This PR rips out async components, once again enabling us to use anything that implements `IntoIterator<T: IntoTemplate>`. It makes our suspense system simpler, with the limitation that it's really only useful for SSR.

Loading states are not implemented, so components will be blank until their data is ready.

This is being done in a forward-compatible way, so we can add loading states and tree-based suspense later into the 0.4 release.

title: Add nicer debug messaging in trace level for hydration

labels.name: web
labels.description: relating to the web renderer for dioxus

body: Adds trace level logs for each node during hydration. This should make it more clear where hydration failed.

title: docs: fix typo in `use_effect` description
Remove the `dioxus` bin for the `dx` bin
body: This PR renames `dioxus` to `dx` in the CLI. It's shorter, cuter, and a little bit more project-agnostic so we can work with other wasm projects and tools.

title: Re-add provide_root_context for lazy singleton initialization
body:
This PR re-adds provide_root_context so crates like signals, routers, etc can lazily initialize their singletons from anywhere in the app.

This could be considered "magic" but I'm leaning more towards the idea that these are singleton objects that are *meant* to be at the top of your app. It would not make sense to have multiple signal runtimes or multiple routers in a single app. These libraries should provide their own mechanisms for "subtrees" that can be built around this behavior.

```
Provide a context to the root and then consume it

This is intended for "global" state management solutions that would rather be implicit for the entire app. Things like signal runtimes and routers are examples of "singletons" that would benefit from lazy initialization.

Note that you should be checking if the context existed before trying to provide a new one. Providing a context when a context already exists will swap the context out for the new one, which may not be what you want.
```

title: better diagnostics for use_shared_state
body:
Currently it is quite hard to debug what causes the panics at runtime, this is an attempt making it a bit less intimidating for new users.
I also propose exposing the `try_*` methods in case someone wanted to handle the errors somehow (current implementation crashes and leaves the application frozen which might be really confusing to end user)

changelist: 
 - expose `try_*` methods on `UseSharedState<T>`
 - add meaningful panic information on `read()`/`write()` errors
 - unify `thiserror`'s versions across all packages and make it a `workspace`-wide dependency
 - above mentioned `read()` / `write()` methods also track callers in debug mode, providing specific location at which borrow error occurred in the panic message

title: Update web.md
body: Updated the link to dioxus-cli from the depricated repo to the new location.

title: CLI HTTPS
body:
Adds support for localhost HTTPs using either custom or [mkcert](https://github.com/FiloSottile/mkcert) auto-generated certificates.

This PR adds a few new ``Dioxus.toml`` options:
```toml
[web.https]
enabled = true
mkcert = false
cert_path = "./cert.pem"
key_path = "./key.pem"
```

mkcert generated certificates are stored in an ``ssl`` folder:
![image](https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/assets/30190859/4fef01d3-fac1-4a5b-a00b-4816966922c0)


Closes #1168

title: Extract the vscode extension into its own module with wasm
body:
Instead of relying on the CLI to be installed, move all the methods for doing extension stuff into its own extension crate.

This should allow the extension to be decoupled from the CLI, making it more reliable.

It also turns on the extension automatically whenever a Rust file is opened, which should make things like autoformatting automatic.

This also releases the extension.

title: fix: Remove duplicated doc links and improved some descriptions
body:
## Changes
- Updated some descriptions to make them more clear
- Removed `documentation` links so they get filled with the generated link from `docs.rs`
- Updated some `homepage` links with platform-specific guides (e.g desktop, tui, ssr, etc)

Feel free to edit anything you think didn't have to be modified 👍

title: Feat: add `dx` as a package and move plugin to feature
body:
We want to alias dioxus to dx now, so the easiest way is to install both so people aren't confused.

`dx` = `dioxus` on the CLI.

Kinda like vc = vercel.

Also, this pulls out the plugin system into a feature to help reduce build times. They're still quite long :/

title: fix: readme awesome link
Use linear scans when searching for contexts
body: We noticed that hash takes up quite a bit of binary size in the final wasm. Also, linear scans are faster for small amounts of items, and most people have between 0-10 contexts in a single component at any moment in time.

title: Use boxes instead of bumpslab for hooks
body:
This removes a little bit of unsafe and is generally kinder to the allocator.

It's also like 1-2% faster, which isn't a huge difference, but now `Drop` is handled automatically, making it harder to abuse.

title: Add iOS + Android example to mainline
body:
Similar to the PWA example, we now integrate iOS into the mainline.

This also features a fix to Dioxus Desktop that broke touch interactions.

title: Fix playwright fullstack clippy
body:
(It is used, just behind feature flags)
![image](https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/assets/30190859/dcd6393e-2e50-4741-9664-1a0ad925b684)

title: Window Close Behaviour
body:
This implements the functionality outlined in the following issue:

https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/issues/1122

For macOS, it adds the `objc` dependency as that is required to call the correct selector, `[NSApplication hide:]`. This will hide the window in a way that it appears again when the user switches back to the app.

On Linux or Windows clicking the icon in the tab bar should make it visible again.

title: Fix playwrite tests
body: Makes the playwrite tests compile with the latest version of fullstack

title: Add a helper macro for properties & async
body:
The to_owned macro is helpful to handle hooks with async components, but when using properties it can be problematic because `cx` will be moved in the async block, and will result in a compilation error. This adds a new helper that allows to make either hooks or properties owned.

Note that the macro could be merged with `to_owned`, but having two macros may be better for discoverability (and the to_owned_props may be more expensive at compile time).

title: Update web.md
body: found a small typo while reading the docs.

title: fix: Fix stop_propagation example
body: I feel bad opening this PR because it's a really small fix

title: Change missing trailing comma span to be more helpful
body:
First time contributing, let me know if something should be different e.g. where I place the test and so on (or if you disagree with the PR altogether).

I noticed if I forget a trailing comma, the span info pointed to the span _before_ the one I expected.

```rust
// user code
rsx!{
  p { class: "foo bar" 
    "hi"
  }
}

// stderr before
error: missing trailing comma
 --> tests/rsx/trailing-comma-0.rs:9:20
  |
9 |             class: "foo bar"
  |             ^^^^^

// stderr after
error: missing trailing comma
 --> tests/rsx/trailing-comma-0.rs:9:20
  |
9 |             class: "foo bar"
  |                    ^^^^^^^^^
```

So I changed the span to the one after, and added a test to verify the new stderr.

title: Stub out File input and RFD on iOS
Add on unmount hook
body: The question of how to clean up side effects has come up several times in the discord. This adds a simple on unmount hook to the Dioxus hooks crate. The hook just uses a drop implementation internally to run when the component is cleaned up

title: Fix CLI testing issue
body:
The ``spawn_properly`` test requires the ``dioxus`` command to be available. In our CI system, it isn't. This PR comments out ``spawn_properly`` and adds a ``test_auto_fmt`` test. 

We could get the ``spawn_properly`` test working in CI but I think it'd be a little tricky and for now, it'd be nice to get CI working correctly.

\- Also fixes CLI clippy complaints

labels.name: desktop
labels.description: Suggestions related to the desktop renderer

title: Fix: Remove play button from guide example
body: Context https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/issues/1097#issuecomment-1603162527

title: Fix the issue of duplicate unique ID for atoms using `newtype`.
body:
Fixes #536 
Fixes #706.

The #562 seems like there hasn't been much progress, but this issue is serious enough that we should fix it as soon as possible. This PR avoids the problem of merged functions having the same address by using `newtype`. I'm using `'static` to ensure that the static variable is created when used. API changes are inevitable, but I believe it's worth it.

 > It's also possible that this is a bug upstream, and I might investigate it in my free time. Perhaps we should consider finding a better solution, and a viable approach could be directly managing some of the state using Atom.

title: Update fermi badge links.
feat: Simplify `use_shared_state` doc example
Make registering server functions optional
body: The latest version of the server functions crate was updated to use inventory to make registering server functions optional. This PR updates Dioxus server functions to the latest commit

title: Workspace Dependancies

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body: Updates the dependencies that are used commonly across Dioxus crates to use [workspace dependencies](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/workspaces.html#the-dependencies-table). This should be helpful keeping the versions of crates across the workspace synced and make it easier to move packages.

title: Fix boolean attributes with raw boolean values
body:
Checks if boolean attributes are equal to either the value `true` or the string `"true"` before choosing to either add or remove the attribute

fixes https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/issues/1086

title: Fix typos on Event Handlers page
replace unmaintained actions-rs/* actions in CI workflows
body:
Basically all of the `actions-rs/*` actions are unmaintained. See <https://github.com/actions-rs/toolchain/issues/216> for more information. Due to their age they generate several warnings in CI runs, for example in https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/actions/runs/5212800825:

> Node.js 12 actions are deprecated. Please update the following actions to use Node.js 16: actions-rs/toolchain@v1, actions-rs/cargo@v1. For more information see: https://github.blog/changelog/2022-09-22-github-actions-all-actions-will-begin-running-on-node16-instead-of-node12/.

To get rid of those warnings the occurrences of `actions-rs/toolchain` are replaced by [`dtolnay/rust-toolchain`](https://github.com/dtolnay/rust-toolchain), and the occurrences of `actions-rs/cargo` are replaced by direct invocations of `cargo`.

_(Requested by @DogeDark  in https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus-std/pull/9#issuecomment-1595030422.)_

title: fixed typo in README
body: Just fixed what I think may a small typo in the README!

title: Increase the size of the queue for the query engine
body:
# Description

Increase the number of tokio channels for the query engine from 8 to 1000. This fixes issues where making many calls to `eval` or `unmounted` would cause said calls to fail with error `Error receiving query result: channel lagged by 8`.

Solves https://github.com/DioxusLabs/dioxus/issues/1092

title: Fix typo
Update All Element Ids

labels.name: core
labels.description: relating to the core implementation of the virtualdom

body:
Fixes #846 

Because we expose the handle_event on the virtual method which dereferences an arbitrary element id pointer, we always need to update the references for element ids, even if we never use the reference internally.

labels.name: core

When events are fired on placeholder elements, Dioxus panics (you run into this issue if you run the fuzzing test in #1064 long enough)

title: Expanded fuzzing

labels.name: core

body:

1) Adding and triggering Listeners
2) Randomly marking nodes as dirty
3) Borrowed props

(CI will likely fail initially because this uncovers some new issues)
